title.narrative: 003 PUBLIC FINANCE FOR CHILDREN

description.narrative: By 2025, capacity of government is strengthened in budgeting in selected sectors at federal and regional levels to improve spending outcomes for children, which contributes to Access To Inclusive Social Protection, Communication And Advocacy, Cross-Sectoral - Human Rights, Cross-Sectoral - Other Programme Areas, Reducing Child Poverty, Reducing Child Poverty (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 'By 2025, girls and boys benefit from an enhanced policy, budgetary environment and services that improve their wellbeing

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2025, capacity of government is strengthened in budgeting in selected sectors at federal and regional levels to improve spendingoutcomes for children

description.narrative: UNICEF Ethiopia continues to engage in public finance monitoring, analysis and advocacy to better inform programme, policy and public budget decisions for children’s rights. UNICEF’s policy advocacy has achieved additional public investments in secondary schools for children. New evidence was produced on costing child health commodities benchmarked in an affordability analysis, as well as first-time estimates of multi-sector public investments for child protection that is enabling UNICEFs’ current policy advocacy for additional public investments in these child-focused social sectors. Strengthened partnerships in budget transparency has enabled Ethiopia to participate for the first time in the Open Budget Survey in 2021. | Status:Met | As-of Date:07/01/2022
